Welding shop shooting.Summary: Junior high school teacher Carl Robert Brown, 51, opened fire inside a welding shop and was later shot dead by a witness as he fled the scene.
Welding shop shooting.Mental health - details: His second wife left him because he refused to seek psychological help. He had become increasingly isolated. One former student said he was "off his rocker."
Welding shop shooting.Where obtained: Garcia Gun Center in Hialeah, Fla.
Welding shop shooting.Weapon details: Mossberg 500 Persuader pump-action shotgun with pistol grip

Dallas nightclub shooting.Summary: Abdelkrim Belachheb, 39, opened fire at an upscale nightclub after a woman rejected his advances. He was later arrested.
Dallas nightclub shooting.Mental health - details: During his last meal with his wife, he confessed he was depressed and had visited psychiatric hospitals in Belgium.
Dallas nightclub shooting.Where obtained: Hines Boulevard Pawn Shop in Dallas, Texas

San Ysidro McDonald's massacre.Summary: James Oliver Huberty, 41, opened fire in a McDonald's restaurant before he was shot dead by a police officer.
San Ysidro McDonald's massacre.Mental health - details: The day before the shooting, he tried to make an appointment at a mental health clinic.
San Ysidro McDonald's massacre.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
San Ysidro McDonald's massacre.Weapon details: 9mm Browning P35 Hi-Power semiautomatic handgun; 9mm Israeli Military Industries Uzi Model A carbine semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Winchester 1200 pump-action shotgun

United States Postal Service shooting.Summary: Postal worker Patrick Sherrill, 44, opened fire at a post office before committing suicide.
United States Postal Service shooting.Mental health - details: He was worried he had inherited mental problems and rebuffed a pastor's suggestion he seek psychiatric counseling. His family members denied he had a history of mental illness.
United States Postal Service shooting.Where obtained: Issued by Oklahoma National Guard, where Sherrill served, for target competition

Shopping centers spree killings.Summary: Retired librarian William Cruse, 59, was paranoid neighbors gossiped that he was gay. He drove to a Publix supermarket, killing two Florida Tech students en route before opening fire outside and killing a woman. He then drove to a Winn-Dixie supermarket and killed three more, including two police officers. Cruse was arrested after taking a hostage and died on death row in 2009.
Shopping centers spree killings.Mental health - details: He suffered from paranoid delusions. A judge found that he suffered from "extreme mental illness."
Shopping centers spree killings.Where obtained: Gun store in Norwood, Ohio; The Oaks Trading Post in Melbourne, Fla.
Shopping centers spree killings.Type of weapons: One rifle, one revolver, one shotgun
Shopping centers spree killings.Weapon details: Sturm, Ruger Mini-14 semiautomatic rifle; 20-gauge Winchester pump-action shotgun; .357 Ruger Blackhawk revolver

ESL shooting.Summary: Former ESL Incorporated employee Richard Farley, 39, gunned down seven people at his former workplace. He was later arrested and now sits on death row at San Quentin.
ESL shooting.Mental health - details: He stalked and harassed his colleague Laura Black for four years until she was granted a temporary restraining order aginst him. Before he was fired for his bizarre behavior, he was ordered to undergo psychological counseling.
ESL shooting.Where obtained: Various sporting goods and gun stores in Northern California
ESL shooting.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle, two revolvers, two shotguns
ESL shooting.Weapon details: .380 ACP Browning, 9mm Smith & Wesson semiautomatic handguns; Ruger M-77 .22-250 bolt-action rifle with scope; Mossberg 12-gauge pump-action, 12-gauge Benelli semiautomatic shotguns; .357 Magnum Smith & Wesson, .22 Sentinel WMR revolvers

Stockton schoolyard shooting.Summary: Patrick Purdy, 26, an alcoholic with a police record, launched an assault at Cleveland Elementary School, where many young Southeast Asian immigrants were enrolled. Purdy killed himself with a shot to the head.
Stockton schoolyard shooting.Mental health - details: He told a mental health professional he was "struggling to resist actions on thoughts which are destructive in nature." He also suffered from alcoholism.
Stockton schoolyard shooting.Where obtained: Sandy Trading Post in Sandy, Ore.; Hunter Loan and Jewelry Co. in Stockton, Calif.
Stockton schoolyard shooting.Weapon details: 9mm Taurus semiautomatic handgun; AK-47 Chinese variant semiautomatic rifle

Standard Gravure shooting.Summary: Joseph T. Wesbecker, 47, gunned down eight people at his former workplace before committing suicide.
Standard Gravure shooting.Mental health - details: Prior to the shooting, he had voluntarily checked into hospitals for mental problems at least twice and attempted suicide three times.
Standard Gravure shooting.Where obtained: AK-47 purchased from Tilford's Gun Sales in Louisville, Ky.
Standard Gravure shooting.Type of weapons: Three semiautomatic handguns (two assault), one rifle (assault), one revolver
Standard Gravure shooting.Weapon details: Two Intratec MAC-11, 9mm SIG Sauer semiautomatic handguns; AK-47 Chinese variant semiautomatic rifle; .38-caliber revolver

GMAC massacre.Summary: James Edward Pough, 42, opened fire at a General Motors Acceptance Corporation office before committing suicide. (The day prior, Pough killed a pimp and prostitute and injured two others. Those victims are not included in the mass murder count.)
GMAC massacre.Mental health - details: Police speculated he had a "grudge" against the people he killed.

Luby's massacre.Summary: George Hennard, 35, drove his pickup truck into a Luby's cafeteria and opened fire before committing suicide.
Luby's massacre.Mental health - details: Acquaintances described him as troubled, unstable, combative, and misogynistic. He made convenience store employees "nervous."
Luby's massacre.Where obtained: Mike's Gun Shop in Henderson, Nev.

University of Iowa shooting.Summary: Former graduate student Gang Lu, 28, went on a rampage on campus and then committed suicide at the scene.
University of Iowa shooting.Mental health - details: He was described as darkly disturbed and isolated.
University of Iowa shooting.Where obtained: Fin & Feather in Iowa City, Iowa

Royal Oak postal shootings.Summary: Laid-off postal worker Thomas McIlvane, 31, opened fire at his former workplace before committing suicide.
Royal Oak postal shootings.Mental health - details: Police revoked his CCW permit after determining he was mentally unstable.

Lindhurst High School shooting.Summary: Former Lindhurst High School student Eric Houston, 20, angry about various personal failings, killed three students and a teacher at the school before surrendering to police after an eight-hour standoff. He was later sentenced to death.
Lindhurst High School shooting.Mental health - details: He suffered violent physical abuse as a child. He claimed a teacher had sexually abused him, but the truth of that allegation was contested.

Watkins Glen killings.Summary: John T. Miller, 50, killed four child-support workers in a county office building before turning the gun on himself.  Miller was upset about a court order garnishing his paycheck to cover overdue child-support payments.
Watkins Glen killings.Mental health - details: The day before the shooting, he told child-support collection office workers that he was considering suicide. He had been convicted of felonious assault for pointing a revolver at police officers responding to a domestic violence report at this girlfriend's apartment.

101 California Street shootings.Summary: Failed businessman Gian Luigi Ferri, 55, opened fire throughout an office building before he committed suicide inside as police pursued him.
101 California Street shootings.Mental health - details: He was down on his luck because of failed business decisions. One acquaintance said, "He was the least likely guy you can imagine doing something like that."  His ex-wife said he "hated violence."
101 California Street shootings.Where obtained: Super Pawn and Pacific Tactical Weapons, both in Las Vegas, Nev.
101 California Street shootings.Weapon details: Two Intratec DC-9, .45-caliber Colt semiautomatic handguns

Luigi's shooting.Summary: Army Sgt. Kenneth Junior French, 22, opened fire inside Luigi's Italian restaurant while ranting about gays in the military before he was shot and arrested by police.
Luigi's shooting.Mental health - details: He had an abusive father, who committed suicide.

Long Island Rail Road massacre.Summary: Colin Ferguson, 35, opened fire on an eastbound Long Island Rail Road train as it approached a Garden City station. He was later arrested.
Long Island Rail Road massacre.Mental health - details: Psychiatrists and others said he suffered from racial paranoia and was obsessed with nonexistent conspiracies. His landlord said he had "delusions of grandeur."
Long Island Rail Road massacre.Where obtained: Turner's Outdoorsman in Signal Hill, Calif.

Chuck E. Cheese's killings.Summary: Nathan Dunlap, 19, a recently fired Chuck E. Cheese's employee, went on a rampage through his former workplace and was arrested the following day. He now awaits execution on death row.
Chuck E. Cheese's killings.Mental health - details: While he was in prison awaiting trial, he started acting bizarre by stripping naked and playing with his feces, apparently to avoid the death penalty. A state doctor testified that Dunlap was was faking his mental illness.

Air Force base shooting.Summary: Former airman Dean Allen Mellberg, 20, opened fire inside a hospital at the Fairchild Air Force Base before he was shot dead by a military police officer outside.
Air Force base shooting.Mental health - details: He was repeatedly diagnosed with emotional problems during his two years of service.

Walter Rossler Company massacre.Summary: Disgruntled former metallurgist James Daniel Simpson, 28, opened fire throughout the Walter Rossler Company where he had worked before exiting the building and committing suicide.
Walter Rossler Company massacre.Mental health - details: He was likely angry because he was given an assignment at work he didn't like. But acquaintances didn't know why he'd come back and kill.

Fort Lauderdale revenge shooting.Summary: Fired city park employee Clifton McCree, 41, opened fire on former coworkers he called "racist devils" inside their municipal trailer in an act of revenge after failing a drug test. He then committed suicide.
Fort Lauderdale revenge shooting.Mental health - details: Co-workers complained about his threats and verbal abuse. His supervisors asked him to get a psychiatric evaluation. He lost his job, which relatives said drove his depression.

R.E. Phelon Company shooting.Summary: Ex-con Hastings Arthur Wise, 43, opened fire at the R.E. Phelon Company in retaliation for being fired after an argument with a supervisor. He attempted suicide by ingesting insecticide, failed, and was executed by the state of South Carolina eight years later.
R.E. Phelon Company shooting.Mental health - details: An ex-con, he had been freed from prison, although he displayed violent tendencies.

Caltrans maintenance yard shooting.Summary: Former Caltrans employee Arturo Reyes Torres, 41, opened fire at a maintenance yard after he was fired for allegedly selling government materials he'd stolen from work. He was shot dead by police.
Caltrans maintenance yard shooting.Mental health - details: He was disgruntled after being fired.
Caltrans maintenance yard shooting.Where obtained: B&B Gun Sales in Orange County, Calif.

Connecticut Lottery shooting.Summary: Lottery worker Matthew Beck, 35, gunned down four bosses over a salary dispute before committing suicide.
Connecticut Lottery shooting.Mental health - details: He had been hospitalized for psychiatric reasons and had a history of depression

Westside Middle School killings.Summary: Mitchell Scott Johnson, 13, and Andrew Douglas Golden, 11, two juveniles, ambushed students and teachers as they left the school; they were apprehended by police at the scene.
Westside Middle School killings.Mental health - details: Boys displayed unruly and aggressive behavior. They picked on kids and made threats about killing people.
Westside Middle School killings.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, two rifles, three revolvers, two derringers
Westside Middle School killings.Weapon details: FIE 380, .380-caliber Star semiautomatic handguns; .44 Magnum Ruger, .30-06 Remington 742, .30-caliber Universal M-1 carbine replica rifles; .38-caliber Charter Arms, .357-caliber Ruger Security Six, .38-caliber Smith & Wesson revolvers; .22-caliber Double Deuce Buddie two-shot, .38-caliber Davis Industries two-shot derringers
Westside Middle School killings.Shooter: Mitchell Scott Johnson, 13; Andrew Douglas Golden, 11

Thurston High School shooting.Summary: After he was expelled for having a gun in his locker, Kipland P. Kinkel, 15, a freshman at Thurston High, went on a shooting spree, killing his parents at home and two students at school. Five classmates wrestled Kipland to the ground before he was arrested.
Thurston High School shooting.Mental health - details: Doctors testified that he was a paranoid schizophrenic who suffered from hallucinations
Thurston High School shooting.Where obtained: Purchased variously from friend and father, and stolen from father
Thurston High School shooting.Weapon details: 9mm Glock, .22-caliber Ruger semiautomatic handguns, .22-caliber Ruger rifle

Columbine High School massacre.Summary: Eric Harris, 18, and Dylan Klebold, 17, opened fire throughout Columbine High School before committing suicide.
Columbine High School massacre.Mental health - details: Harris was an alleged psychopath; Klebold was depressed and suicidal.
Columbine High School massacre.Where obtained: Purchased variously at Tanner Gun Show in Denver, Colo. and from an individual
Columbine High School massacre.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun (assault), one rifle (assault), two shotguns
Columbine High School massacre.Weapon details: 9mm Intratec DC-9 semiautomatic handgun; 9mm Hi-Point 995 carbine rifle; 12-gauge sawed-off Savage Stevens 311D, 12-gauge sawed-off Savage Springfield 67H pump-action shotguns

Atlanta day trading spree killings.Summary: Day trader Mark O. Barton, 44, who had recently lost a substantial sum of money, went on a shooting spree through two day-trading firms. He started at the All-Tech Investment Group, where he worked, then went on to Momentum Securities. He fled and hours later, after being cornered by police outside a gas station, committed suicide. (Two days before the spree, he killed his wife and two children with a hammer.)
Atlanta day trading spree killings.Mental health - details: In letters, he details his deep depression and downward spiral.
Atlanta day trading spree killings.Where obtained: Glock purchased from gun store in Warner Robins, Ga.
Atlanta day trading spree killings.Weapon details: .45-caliber Colt 1911-A1, 9mm Glock 17, .25-caliber Raven Arms MP-25 semiautomatic handguns; .22-caliber Harrington & Richardson revolver

Wedgwood Baptist Church shooting.Summary: Larry Gene Ashbrook, 47, opened fire inside the Wedgwood Baptist Church during a prayer rally before committing suicide.
Wedgwood Baptist Church shooting.Mental health - details: His siblings decribed him as a paranoid schizophrenic.
Wedgwood Baptist Church shooting.Where obtained: Trader's Village flea market in Grand Prairie, Texas

Xerox killings.Summary: Byran Koji Uyesugi, 40, a Xerox service technician, opened fire inside the building with a 9mm Glock. He fled and was later apprehended by police.
Xerox killings.Mental health - details: A psychiatrist, testifying for the prosecution,said he suffered from schizophrenia.
Xerox killings.Where obtained: Hunting Supplies of Hawaii (The Armory) in Honolulu, Hawaii

Hotel shooting.Summary: Hotel employee Silvio Leyva, 36, gunned down four coworkers at the Radisson Bay Harbor Inn before killing a woman outside who refused to give him her car. He was arrested shortly after the shootings.
Hotel shooting.Mental health - details: His brother called him "unbalanced" and mentally ill.
Hotel shooting.Where obtained: One purchased from Big E's in Tampa, Fla.
Hotel shooting.Weapon details: 9mm Lorcin semiautomatic handgun; .38-caliber Charter Arms revolver

Wakefield massacre.Summary: Michael McDermott, 42, opened fire on co-workers at Edgewater Technology and was later arrested.
Wakefield massacre.Mental health - details: Psychiatrist guessed he had schizophrenia, but McDermott had researched how to fake a mental illness on the internet. Defense lawyer described history of suicide attempts and mental illness dating back to teen years. Jury rejected his insanity defense.

Wakefield massacre.Weapon details: .32-caliber Retolaza semiautomatic handgun; AK-47 variant semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Winchester 1300 pump-action shotgun

Navistar shooting.Summary: Fired employee William D. Baker, 66, opened fire at his former Navistar workplace before committing suicide.
Navistar shooting.Mental health - details: He had a criminal past, including a sexual assault conviction.
Navistar shooting.Where obtained: Some purchased from Pepper Sports in Glen Ellyn, Ill.
Navistar shooting.Type of weapons: Two rifles, one revolver, one shotgun
Navistar shooting.Weapon details: SKS 1954R, .30-caliber Winchester rifles; 12-gauge Remington pump-action shotgun; .38-caliber revolver

Lockheed Martin shooting.Summary: Assembly line worker Douglas Williams, 48, opened fire at his Lockheed Martin workplace in a racially motivated attack before committing suicide.
Lockheed Martin shooting.Mental health - details: His cousin said he was depressed and "going through a lot of things."
Lockheed Martin shooting.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun, two rifles, one derringer, one shotgun
Lockheed Martin shooting.Weapon details: .45-caliber Ruger P90 semiautomatic handgun; .22-caliber rifle with scope, .223-caliber Ruger Mini-14 rifle; 12-gauge Winchester 1300 shotgun; .22 Magnum derringer

Damageplan show shooting.Summary: Nathan Gale, 25, possibly upset about the breakup of Pantera, gunned down former Pantera guitarist Dimebag Darrell and three others at a Damageplan show before a police officer fatally shot Gale.
Damageplan show shooting.Mental health - details: He was discharged from the military because he was a paranoid schizophrenic.
Damageplan show shooting.Where obtained: Received as a gift from mother

Living Church of God shooting.Summary: Living Church of God member Terry Michael Ratzmann, 44, opened fire at a church meeting at a Sheraton hotel before committing suicide.
Living Church of God shooting.Mental health - details: Neighbors said he suffered from depression and had a drinking problem.

Red Lake massacre.Summary: Jeffrey Weise, 16, murdered his grandfather, who was a police officer, and grandfather's girlfriend. Weise then drove his grandfather's squad car to Red Lake Senior High School and opened fire on the reservation campus, killing another seven people before committing suicide.
Red Lake massacre.Mental health - details: He voluntarily visited a a psychiatric ward. He was hospitalized at least once for suicidal tendencies and was taking Prozac.
Red Lake massacre.Where obtained: Glock and Remington stolen from grandfather
Red Lake massacre.Weapon details: .40-caliber Glock 23, .22-caliber Ruger semiautomatic handguns; 12-gauge Remington 870 shotgun

Goleta postal shootings.Summary: Former postal worker Jennifer Sanmarco, 44, shot dead a former neighbor then drove to the mail processing plant where she used to work. Inside, she opened fire, killing six employees before committing suicide.
Goleta postal shootings.Mental health - details: She was placed on retirement disability for psychological reasons. Fellow employees described her behavior as increasingly bizarre. She believed the Postal Service employees were conspiring against her.
Goleta postal shootings.Where obtained: Pawn shops in Grants and Gallup, N.M.

Capitol Hill massacre.Summary: Kyle Aaron Huff, 28, opened fire at a rave afterparty in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle before committing suicide.
Capitol Hill massacre.Mental health - details: Police were unable to find any record that he had been treated for mental illness or was on psychiatric medication.
Capitol Hill massacre.Where obtained: Various sporting goods stores in Kalispell, Mont.
Capitol Hill massacre.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun

Amish school shooting.Summary: Charles Carl Roberts, 32, shot 10 young girls in a one-room schoolhouse in Bart Township, killing 5, before taking his own life.
Amish school shooting.Mental health - details: He told his wife that he'd molested two young relatives 20 years ago.

Trolley Square shooting.Summary: Sulejman Talović, 18, rampaged through the shopping center until he was shot dead by police.
Trolley Square shooting.Mental health - details: According to one relative, he was violent and had the mental capacity of a child. (But accounts from others did not indicate this about the shooter.)
Trolley Square shooting.Where obtained: Purchased variously from Sportsman's Fast Cash in West Valley City, Utah and individuals
Trolley Square shooting.Weapon details: Mossberg Maverick 88 Field shotgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson M36 revolver

Virginia Tech massacre.Summary: Virginia Tech student Seung-Hui Cho, 23, opened fire on his school's campus before committing suicide.
Virginia Tech massacre.Mental health - details: A district court ruled Cho was "an imminent danger" to himself and others as a result of mental illness two years earlier, and directed Cho to seek treatment.
Virginia Tech massacre.Where obtained: Purchased variously online and from Roanoke Firearms in Roanoke, Va.

Crandon shooting.Summary: Off-duty sheriff's deputy Tyler Peterson, 20, opened fire inside an apartment after an argument at a homecoming party. He fled the scene and later committed suicide.
Crandon shooting.Mental health - details: The families of victims filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the county arguing that the police department should have evaluated the gunman's mental health before hiring him.
Crandon shooting.Where obtained: Issued by Forest County Sheriff's Department

Westroads Mall shooting.Summary: Robert A. Hawkins, 19, opened fire inside Westroads Mall before committing suicide.
Westroads Mall shooting.Mental health - details: He had been treated in the past for depression and ADHD.

Kirkwood City Council shooting.Summary: Charles "Cookie" Lee Thornton, 52, went on a rampage at the city hall before being shot and killed by police.
Kirkwood City Council shooting.Mental health - details: He was known for histrionics and disruptions at city council meetings. His mounting debt was a stressor.
Kirkwood City Council shooting.Where obtained: Taken in burglary and from fallen police officer
Kirkwood City Council shooting.Weapon details: .40-caliber Smith & Wesson semiautomatic handgun; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson Model 29 revolver

Northern Illinois University shooting.Summary: Steven Kazmierczak, 27, opened fire in a lecture hall, then shot and killed himself before police arrived.
Northern Illinois University shooting.Mental health - details: He had a long history of mental health struggles; after high school, his parents placed him at a psychiatric treatment center. He told friends he left the Army after six months due to a psychological discharge.
Northern Illinois University shooting.Where obtained: Online and gun retailers in Champaign, Ill.
Northern Illinois University shooting.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 19, Hi-Point CF380, 9mm Kurz SIG Sauer P232 semiautomatic handguns; 12-gauge Remington Sportsman 48 sawed-off shotgun

Atlantis Plastics shooting.Summary: Disgruntled employee Wesley Neal Higdon, 25, shot up an Atlantis Plastics factory after he was escorted out of his workplace for an argument with a supervisor. Higdon shot the supervisor outside the factory before opening fire on coworkers inside. He then committed suicide.
Atlantis Plastics shooting.Mental health - details: He called his girlfriend two hours before the shooting to say he was going to kill his boss.

Carthage nursing home shooting.Summary: Robert Stewart, 45, opened fire at a nursing home where his estranged wife worked before he was shot and arrested by a police officer.
Carthage nursing home shooting.Mental health - details: His estranged wife told her workplace that her husband had an "unstable mental state or (was) mentally ill."
Carthage nursing home shooting.Where obtained: Local sporting goods stores and individuals

Binghamton shootings.Summary: Jiverly Wong, 41, opened fire at an American Civic Association center for immigrants before committing suicide.
Binghamton shootings.Mental health - details: He apparently harbored growing paranoia toward cops. He also sent a delusional letter to a local TV station right before the shooting.
Binghamton shootings.Where obtained: Gander Mountain in Johnson City, N.Y.

Fort Hood massacre.Summary: Army psychiatrist Nidal Malik Hasan, 39, opened fire on an Army base in an attack linked to Islamist extremism. Hasan was injured during the attack and later arrested.
Fort Hood massacre.Mental health - details: Medical officials at Walter Reed Army Medical Center and the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences raised concerns prior to the shooting regarding Hasan's aloof and erratic behavior and extremist Islamic views.

Coffee shop police killings.Summary: Maurice Clemmons, 37, a felon who was out on bail for child-rape charges, entered a coffee shop on a Sunday morning and shot four police officers who had gone there to use their laptops before their shifts. Clemmons, who was wounded fleeing the scene, was later shot dead by a police officer in Seattle after a two-day manhunt.
Coffee shop police killings.Mental health - details: He had a history of erratic, bizarre behavior. He once asked his family to get naked for 5 minutes on Sunday; he said he thought the world would end and that he was Jesus.
Coffee shop police killings.Where obtained: Stolen from an individual in Seattle.
Coffee shop police killings.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 17 semiautomatic handgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson revolver

Hartford Beer Distributor shooting.Summary: Omar S. Thornton, 34, shot up his Hartford Beer Distributor workplace after facing disciplinary issues, then committed suicide.
Hartford Beer Distributor shooting.Mental health - details: He apparently was driven over the edge by unaddressed, ongoing racism against him at work
Hartford Beer Distributor shooting.Where obtained: Gun dealer in East Windsor, Conn.

Tucson shooting.Summary: Jared Loughner, 22, opened fire outside a Safeway during a constituent meeting with Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords (D-Ariz.) before he was subdued by bystanders and arrested.
Tucson shooting.Mental health - details: His symptoms pointed to various possible mental illness diagnoses, such as schizophrenia and delusional disorder. He also experimented with pot and hallucinogens.

IHOP shooting.Summary: Eduardo Sencion, 32, opened fire at an International House of Pancakes restaurant and later died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
IHOP shooting.Mental health - details: He was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia as a teenager and feared demons were out to get him.
IHOP shooting.Weapon details: AK-47 Norinco Arms variant, AK-47 Romarm Cugir variant rifles; .38-caliber Colt revolver

Seal Beach shooting.Summary: Scott Evans Dekraai, 42, opened fire inside a hair salon and was later arrested.

Seal Beach shooting.Weapon details: .45-caliber Heckler & Koch, 9mm Springfield semiautomatic handguns; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson revolver

Su Jung Health Sauna shooting.Summary: Jeong Soo Paek, 59, returned to a Korean spa from which he'd been kicked out after an altercation. He gunned down two of his sisters and their husbands before committing suicide.
Su Jung Health Sauna shooting.Mental health - details: His sister worried about his homicidal tendencies; she said his mental health had been deteriorating and that he had threatened to commit suicide with his gun.

Oikos University killings.Summary: One L. Goh, 43, a former student, opened fire in a nursing classroom. He fled the scene by car and was arrested nearby a few hours later.
Oikos University killings.Mental health - details: A former instructor at Oikos described him as "mentally unstable" and "paranoid."

Seattle cafe shooting.Summary: Ian Stawicki, 40, gunned down four patrons at a cafe, and another person during a carjacking nearby, then shot himself as police closed in. (He died later that day in a Seattle hospital.)
Seattle cafe shooting.Mental health - details: His family said he was mentally ill
Seattle cafe shooting.Where obtained: Bull's Eye Shooter Supply in Tacoma, Wash.

Aurora theater shooting.Summary: James Holmes, 24, opened fire in a movie theater during the opening night of "The Dark Night Rises" and was later arrested outside.

Sikh temple shooting.Summary: U.S. Army veteran Wade Michael Page, 40, opened fire in a Sikh gurdwara before he died from a self-inflicted gunshot would during a shootout with police.
Sikh temple shooting.Mental health - details: His Army friends once broke into his apartment, fearing he'd commit suicide in the '90s. A psychiatric nurse who lived downstairs from Page said it was "obvious" he had a mental illness.

Accent Signage Systems shooting.Summary: Andrew Engeldinger, 36, upon learning he was being fired, went on a shooting rampage, killing the business owner, three fellow employees, and a UPS driver. He then killed himself.
Accent Signage Systems shooting.Mental health - details: His family worried about his "paranoia and delusions" for at least two years prior, and tried to get him to seek treatment.

Sandy Hook Elementary massacre.Summary: Adam Lanza, 20, shot his mother dead at their home then drove to Sandy Hook Elementary school. He forced his way inside and opened fire, killing 20 children and six adults before committing suicide.
Sandy Hook Elementary massacre.Mental health - details: Lanza had a history of serious mental health problems that were known to his family and others, as detailed in a post-massacre investigation by Connecticut authorities.
Sandy Hook Elementary massacre.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun (assault)
Sandy Hook Elementary massacre.Weapon details: 10mm Glock, 9mm SIG Sauer P226 semiautomatic handguns; .223 Bushmaster XM15-E2S semiautomatic rifle; Izhmash Saiga-12 12-gauge semiautomatic shotgun

Mohawk Valley shootings.Summary: Kurt Myers, 64, shot six people in neighboring towns, killing two in a barbershop and two at a car care business, before being killed by officers in a shootout after a nearly 19-hour standoff.

Pinewood Village Apartment shooting.Summary: Dennis Clark III, 27, shot and killed his girlfriend in their shared apartment, and then shot two witnesses in the building's parking lot and a third victim in another apartment, before being killed by police.
Pinewood Village Apartment shooting.Weapon details: .40 caliber semi-automatic handgun, pistol grip shotgun

Santa Monica rampage.Summary: John Zawahri, 23, armed with a homemade assault rifle and high-capacity magazines, killed his brother and father at home and then headed to Santa Monica College, where he was eventually killed by police.
Santa Monica rampage.Mental health - details: He was known as a solitary teen who regularly ditched class and had an interest in assault weapons; he had been admitted to UCLA's psychiatric ward for a brief period.

Hialeah apartment shooting.Summary: Pedro Vargas, 42, set fire to his apartment, killed six people in the complex, and held another two hostages at gunpoint before a SWAT team stormed the building and fatally shot him.
Hialeah apartment shooting.Mental health - details: His mother told authorities her son had been acting strangely and needed a psychiatric evaluation.

Washington Navy Yard shooting.Summary: Aaron Alexis, 34, a military veteran and contractor from Texas, opened fire in the Navy installation, killing 12 people and wounding 8 before being shot dead by police.
Washington Navy Yard shooting.Mental health - details: Had told Rhode Island police the prior month that he'd "heard voices"; had been undergoing mental health treatment with Veterans Affairs since August 2013.
Washington Navy Yard shooting.Type of weapons: Sawed-off shotgun, 2 boxes of shells; also a .45-caliber handgun taken from a security guard he shot at the scene.

Alturas tribal shooting.Summary: Cherie Lash Rhoades, 44, opened fire at the Cedarville Rancheria Tribal Office and Community Center, killing four and wounding two. After running out of ammunition, Rhoades grabbed a butcher knife and stabbed another person.
Alturas tribal shooting.Type of weapons: Two handguns and a butcher knife

Fort Hood shooting 2.Summary: Army Specialist Ivan Lopez, 34, opened fire at the Fort Hood Army Post in Texas, killing three and wounding at least 12 others before shooting himself in the head after engaging with military police. Lt. Gen. Mark A. Milley told reporters that Lopez "had behavioral health and mental health" issues.
Fort Hood shooting 2.Mental health - details: Lopez "had a long history of troubling behavior," according to the Washington Post, including a history of decieving others, problems in his personal life, and financial difficulties. However, officials found that Lopez exhibited no signals that he could be violent. In the year leading up to the attack, he sought treatment for medical and behavioral health ailments.
Fort Hood shooting 2.Where obtained: Local gun store in Killeen, Guns Galore

Isla Vista mass murder.Summary: Elliot Rodger, 22, shot three people to death in the college town of Isla Vista near the University of California, Santa Barbara. He also shot others as he drove around town, and injured others by striking them with is vehicle. He committed suicide by shooting himself in his car as police closed in. Prior to the rampage, Rodger stabbed three people to death at his apartment.
Isla Vista mass murder.Mental health - details: Rodger was never hospitalized due to mental illness, but had a long history of mental health issues dating back to his childhood, and received treatment from multiple counselors leading up to his rampage. According to The Independent, Rodger had considered suicide but had no history of violence. Just before his rampage, he sent a 137-page manifesto to multiple people.
Isla Vista mass murder.Type of weapons: Three semi-automatic handguns and two hunting knives
Isla Vista mass murder.Weapon details: Two Sig Sauer P226 semiautomatic pistols and Glock 34 pistol, and hundreds of rounds of ammo. A 6- inchand 8-inch “SRK” and “Boar Hunter” hunting knives.

Marysville-Pilchuck High School shooting.Summary:
Jaylen Fryberg, 15, using a .40-caliber Berretta, shot five 
students at Marysville High School, including two of his cousins and three friends, killing all but one. Fryberg arranged to meet them for lunch in the school cafeteria by text. Fryberg was reportedly well-liked at the school and there was not believed to be any ill-will between him and his victims. He committed suicide at the scene.
Marysville-Pilchuck High School shooting.Mental health - details: Fryberg was well-liked and allegedly happy, but was also upset about a girl and had posted emotional social media messages. No definitive signs of mental health problems.

Trestle Trail bridge shooting.Summary: Sergio Valencia del Toro, 27, in what officials say was a random act, shot and killed three people including an 11-year-old girl before turning the gun on himself.
Trestle Trail bridge shooting.Mental health - details: While serving in the Air Force, he went to an emergency walk-in clinic because of concerns over his mood swings, and had either sought or been ordered to behavioral health interventions, according to Fox 6 Now. In a 2014 risk assessment with a psychologist at an outpatient clinic in Appleton, Valencia del Toro recalled thinking previously: "If I'm gonna take myself out, I might as well take other people with me." The police report obtained by Fox 6 says that Valencia del Toro had a history of depression, suicidal and occassionally homicidal thoughts, and alcoholism. He was intoxicated on the day of the shooting.
Trestle Trail bridge shooting.Weapon details: Details unclear, but after the shooting, police found eight guns in total in Valencia del Toro's home, including handguns, shotguns, and rifles, plus and more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition. He took two weapons and ammunition to the bridge.

Charleston Church Shooting.Summary: Dylann Storm Roof, 21, shot and killed 9 people after opening fire at the Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, South Carolina. According to a roommate, he had allegedly been “planning something like that for six months."
Charleston Church Shooting.Where obtained: Shooter's Choice gun store in West Columbia, South Carolina

Chattanooga military recruitment center.Summary: Kuwaiti-born Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, 24, a naturalized US citizen, opened fire at a Naval reserve center, and then drove to a military recruitment office where he shot and killed four Marines and a Navy service member, and wounded a police officer and another military service member. He was then fatally shot in an exchange of gunfire with law enforcement officers responding to the attack.
Chattanooga military recruitment center.Mental health - details: Abdulazeez "had suffered for years from depression and possibly from bipolar disorder," according to a representative of the family. (NYT, July 20 2015)
Chattanooga military recruitment center.Weapons obtained legally: Yes ("some of the weapons were purchased legally and some of them may not have been")

Umpqua Community College shooting.Summary: 26-year-old Chris Harper Mercer opened fire at Umpqua Community College in southwest Oregon. The gunman shot himself to death after being wounded in a shootout with police.
Umpqua Community College shooting.Mental health - details: Harper-Mercer's mother said in multiple online postings that he had Asperger's syndrome. Harper-Mercer graduated from the Switzer Learning Center, a school for students with special needs, emotional difficulties, autism and Asperger's syndrome.
Umpqua Community College shooting.Where obtained: From the home he shared with his mother. All were legally obtained by either Harper/Mercer or family members.
Umpqua Community College shooting.Type of weapons: Five pistols, one rifle, five magazines of ammunition
Umpqua Community College shooting.Weapon details: 9 mm Glock pistol, .40 caliber Smith & Wesson, .40 caliber Taurus pistol, .556 caliber Del-Ton; (ammo details unclear)

Colorado Springs shooting rampage.Summary: Noah Harpham, 33, shot three people before dead in Colorado Springs before police killed him in a shootout.
Colorado Springs shooting rampage.Mental health - details: Prior to the rampage, Harpham wrote an "incoherent" blog and rambled "nonsensically" in a YouTube video about mind control techniques and God, according to the Denver Post. He had a history of drug and alcohol abuse.
Colorado Springs shooting rampage.Weapon details: AR-15 rifle, a 9 mm pistol, and a .357 revolver

Planned Parenthood clinic.Summary: Robert Lewis Dear, 57, shot and killed a police officer and two citizens when he opened fire at a Planned Parenthood health clinic in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Nine others were wounded. Dear was arrested after an hours-long standoff with police.
Planned Parenthood clinic.Mental health - details: The judge in the case has not publicly released Dear's medical and mental health records. As of April 5, 2016, Dear was undergoing a competency evaluation. Dear had a history of disputes with his relatives and neighbors. At a hearing in December 2015, he said, "I am a warrior for the babies."
Planned Parenthood clinic.Weapon details: Reportedly an AK-47 style semiautomatic rifle and others. Authorities had not released details on Dear's weapons as of April 2016.

San Bernardino mass shooting.Summary: Syed Rizwan Farook left a Christmas party held at Inland Regional Center, later returning with Tashfeen Malik and the two opened fire, killing 14 and wounding 21, ten critically. The two were later killed by police as they fled in an SUV.
San Bernardino mass shooting.Where obtained: The suspects purchased their handguns in the United States; the assault rifles were purchased by a third party.
San Bernardino mass shooting.Type of weapons: Two assault rifles and two semi-automatic pistols were used in the attack. Police found a remote controlled explosive device at the scene of the crime. At the home were 12 pipe bombs, 2,500 rounds for the AR-15 variants, 2,000 rounds for the pistols, and several hundred for a .22 calibre rifle. In the suspects' car were an additional 1,400 rounds for the rifles and 200 for the handguns.
San Bernardino mass shooting.Weapon details: Two semiautomatic AR-15-style rifles—one a DPMS A-15, the other a Smith & Wesson M&P15, both with .223 calibre ammunition. Two 9mm semiautomatic handguns. High capacity magazines.

Kalamazoo shooting spree.Summary: Jason B. Dalton, a driver for Uber, apparently selected his victims randomly as he went on a rampage over several hours in three different locations, including five people he shot in the parking lot of a Cracker Barrel restaurant. He was "arrested without incident" at a downtown Kalamazoo bar about six hours after the rampage began.

Excel Industries mass shooting.Summary: Cedric L. Ford, who worked as a painter at a manufacturing company, shot victims from his car and at his workplace before being killed by police at the scene. Shortly before the rampage he had been served with a restraining order.
Excel Industries mass shooting.Weapon details: Zastava Serbia AK-47-style rifle, Glock Model 22 .40-caliber handgun; high-capacity magazines (30 rounds)

Orlando nightclub massacre.Summary: Omar Mateen, 29, attacked the Pulse nighclub in Orlando in the early morning hours of June 12. He was killed by law enforcement who raided the club after a prolonged standoff.
Orlando nightclub massacre.Where obtained: Shooting center in Port St. Lucie, Florida
Orlando nightclub massacre.Weapon details: Sig Sauer MCX rifle, Glock 17 9mm; high-capacity magazines (30 rounds)

Dallas police shooting.Summary: Micah Xavier Johnson, a 25-year-old Army veteran, targeted police at a peaceful Black Lives Matter protest, killing five officers and injuring nine others as well as two civilians. After a prolonged standoff in a downtown building, law enforcement killed Johnson using a robot-delivered bomb.
Dallas police shooting.Weapon details: Izhmash-Saiga 5.45mm (AK-style) semiautomatic rifle with large capacity magazines; Glock 9mm handgun, .25-caliber semiautomatic handgun

Baton Rouge police shooting.Summary: Gavin Long, a former Marine who served in Iraq, killed three police offers responding to a 911 call, and wounded three others. He was killed in a shoot-out with other officers responding to the scene. Prior to the attack, Long posted prolifically on social media, where he expressed admiration for the cop killer in Dallas 10 days prior.
Baton Rouge police shooting.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic rifles; one semiautomatic handgun
Baton Rouge police shooting.Weapon details: IWI Tavor SAR 5.56 caliber rifle, Springfield XD 9, 9mm

Cascade Mall shooting.Summary: Arcan Cetin, 20, killed a teen girl and three women in the cosmetics section of a Macy’s department store at the Cascade Mall. A man was critically wounded in the shooting and taken to Harborview Medical Center in Seattle, where he died. Cetin was apprehended by police a few hours after the shooting while driving a car near his residence.
Cascade Mall shooting.Mental health - details: According to the Cetin's stepfather he had "mental health issues"; court records showed that he suffered from anxiety and depression.

Fort Lauderdale airport shooting.Summary: Esteban Santiago, 26, flew from Alaska to Fort Lauderdale, where he opened fire in the baggage claim area of the airport, killing five and wounding six before police aprehended him.
Fort Lauderdale airport shooting.Total victims: 11 (dozens more were injured in the panic)
Fort Lauderdale airport shooting.Mental health - details: Among other signs, Santiago had gone to a FBI office in Anchorage and complained that his mind was being controlled by the CIA.

Fresno downtown shooting.Summary: Kori Ali Muhammad, 39, opened fire along a street in downtown Fresno, killing three people randomly in an alleged hate crime prior to being apprehended by police. Muhammad, who is black, killed three white victims and later described his attack as being racially motivated; he also reportedly yelled 'Allahu Akbar' at the time he was arrested, but authorities indicated they found no links to Islamist terrorism.

Rural Ohio nursing home shooting.Summary: Thomas Hartless, 43, shot and killed a former girlfriend and another employee of a nursing home, and then fatally shot the Kirkersville police chief responding to the scene. Hartless' former girlfriend had recently obtained a court protection order against Hartless. Investigators later found more than 60 firearms in the home of Hartless, who was also found dead at the scene of the attack.
Rural Ohio nursing home shooting.Mental health - details: Hartless had a violent criminal history; his former girlfriend had submitted a letter in court recently stating that he had "a severe mental disorder."

Florida awning manufacturer shooting.Summary: John Robert Neumann, Jr., 45, a former employee of manufacturer Fiamma Inc. fatally shot five workers at the company, and then killed himself on the scene. He'd been fired from the company in April. The attack took place a week before the one-year anniversary of the Orlando nightclub massacre.

Pennsylvania supermarket shooting.Summary: Randy Stair, a 24-year-old worker at Weis grocery fatally shot three of his fellow employees. He reportedly fired 59 rounds with a pair of shotguns before turning the gun on himself as another co-worker fled the scene for help and law enforcement responded.

San Francisco UPS shooting.Summary: Jimmy Lam, 38, fatally shot three coworkers and wounded two others inside a UPS facility in San Francisco. Lam killed himself as law enforcement officers responded to the scene.
San Francisco UPS shooting.Mental health - details: Lam had a history of domestic, work conflict
San Francisco UPS shooting.Where obtained: Unclear; the firearm was stolen in Utah. A second handgun Lam had (also stolen) was unused in the attack.
San Francisco UPS shooting.Weapon details: MAC-10-style “assault pistol”; 30-round magazine. An additional box of ammunition.

Las Vegas Strip massacre.Summary: Stephen Craig Paddock, 64, rained a barrage of rapid gunfire down on thousands of concertgoers on the Las Vegas Strip late on a Sunday night, firing from a room on the 32nd floor of the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casinos. Shortly thereafter, he was found by law enforcement, deceased from a self-inflicted gunshot wound inside the hotel room.
Las Vegas Strip massacre.Mental health - details: Perpetrator's history unclear. In 1969 Paddock's father was classified by the FBI as a dangerous psychopath with suicidal tendencies; psychopathy can be heritable (see Mother Jones sourcing).
Las Vegas Strip massacre.Type of weapons: 23 firearms, mostly rifles; including scopes, and two modified for "fully automatic" firing; two were mounted on tripods
Las Vegas Strip massacre.Weapon details: AR-15-style and AK-47-style rifles and "a large cache of ammunition"; four Daniel Defense DDM4 rifles, three FN-15s and other rifles made by Sig Sauer.

Edgewood businees park shooting.Summary: Radee Labeeb Prince, 37, fatally shot three people and wounded two others around 9am at Advance Granite Solutions, a home remodeling business where he worked near Baltimore. Hours later he shot and wounded a sixth person at a car dealership in Wilmington, Delaware. He was apprehended that evening following a manhunt by authorities.

Walmart shooting in suburban Denver.Summary: Scott Allen Ostrem, 47, walked into a Walmart in a suburb north of Denver and fatally shot two men and a woman, then left the store and drove away. After an all-night manhunt, Ostrem, who had financial problems but no serious criminal history, was captured by police after being spotted near his apartment in Denver.

Newtown school shooting.Type of weapons (all): Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun (assault)

Aurora theater shooting.Type of weapons (all): Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun

Amish school shooting.Type of weapons (all): One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle, one shotgun

Capitol Hill massacre.Type of weapons (all): Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun

Lockheed Martin shooting.Type of weapons (all): One semiautomatic handgun, two rifles, one derringer, one shotgun

Navistar shooting.Type of weapons (all): Two rifles, one revolver, one shotgun

Wakefield massacre.Type of weapons (all): One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle (assault), one shotgun

Columbine High School massacre.Type of weapons (all): One semiautomatic handgun (assault), one rifle (assault), two shotguns

Westside Middle School killings.Type of weapons (all): Two semiautomatic handguns, two rifles, three revolvers, two derringers

Standard Gravure shooting.Type of weapons (all): Three semiautomatic handguns (two assault), one rifle (assault), one revolver

ESL shooting.Type of weapons (all): Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle, two revolvers, two shotguns

Shopping centers spree killings.Type of weapons (all): One rifle, one revolver, one shotgun

San Ysidro McDonald's massacre.Type of weapons (all): One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
